title: The battle which will decide Man United vs Liverpool, according to Jamie Carragher and Gary Neville
text:
Sport The battle which will decide Man United vs Liverpool, according to Jamie Carragher and Gary Neville Liverpool are second in the table but sixth placed United can cut the gap to just two points with victory at Old Trafford on Sunday Share Carragher and Neville were sworn enemies when it came to United vs Liverpool games (Photo: Michael Regan/Getty) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Years of squaring up to each other in Manchester United vs Liverpool clashes have seen Gary Neville and Jamie Carragher continue their disagreements off the pitch as pundits. 
But, speaking ahead of Sunday's huge Premier League game, the retired defenders have found some common ground. 
Jurgen Klopp 's Liverpool are second in the table but sixth placed United can cut the gap to just two points with victory at Old Trafford on Sunday 
Carragher is concerned for Liverpool with Paul Pogba 's form and Neville is convinced the battle in midfield will be "critical" to the outcome. 
Speaking to Sky Sports , Carragher said: "Central midfield is important in any game and with the form Pogba is in, Liverpool will need to be wary of that. 
"Liverpool haven’t been good enough in that area in the last few weeks. Emre Can has gone off the boil and if Liverpool were to pick a first-choice XI, he would probably be just outside that. The pair agree that Pogba and Ibrahimovic will have LIverpool worried this Sunday (Photo: Reuters) Mourinho must be ready for Liverpool to "disturb" Michael Carrick's composure, says Neville (Photo: John Peters) 
"He has still played a lot because the manager likes him and Jordan Henderson has been out, but he has been a little bit off. He can’t afford to let that happen if he plays." 
Neville has his own theory as to how the Liverpool boss will set his side up and the tactics the German will employ against Jose Mourinho 's team. 
He added: "I imagine Klopp will want to disturb Michael Carrick’s composure. The key area will probably be Liverpool’s midfield trio against Pogba, Ander Herrera and Carrick. Read More 
"The other two wide players will come into the pockets and that midfield battle will be a critical one in the game." 
Carragher also hailed the performances of United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic this season. 
He went on: "A lot also depends on how Liverpool deal with Zlatan Ibrahimovic, who is playing as well as anyone in the Premier League right now. He has been scoring goals and Liverpool continue to concede them, so that is another vital area." Klopp and Mourinho must get their tactics spot on on Sunday (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) The pair clash in the Old Trafford fixture in March 2010 (Photo: Matthew Peters/Manchester United via Getty) Read More Man Utd v Liverpool: Just TWO Anfield stars make Robbie Savage's all-time combined derby XI - do you agree? 
And Nevile agreed, adding: "The personality and character of Ibrahimovic is having a massive impact upon the players in the United dressing room. 
"You talk about managers having an influence in the dressing room, but when they’re out on the pitch, Ibrahimovic’s influence is huge. It feels like Liverpool will have to handle his personality and character on Sunday."
